summary: This is a sealed transcript of a conference before Chief District Judge Colleen McMahon regarding a grand jury subpoena (19 Misc. 149). The government attorney provides details about the opening of an investigation in late November/early December 2018 and contacts with the law firm Boies Schiller regarding potential victims or witnesses. The judge grants the government's request related to the subpoena.

persons.name: Colleen McMahon
persons.context: Presiding judge over the sealed grand jury subpoena conference. She questions the government about contacts with the Boies Schiller firm prior to the subpoena's issuance.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Listed as the United States Attorney in the appearances section of the transcript.

events.title: Investigation Opened (Possible Date)
events.description: The government states the investigation was opened either on Friday, November 30, 2018.

events.title: Investigation Opened (Possible Date)
events.description: The government states the investigation was opened either on Monday, December 3, 2018.

events.title: Court Conference on Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: Sealed court conference before Judge McMahon regarding the grand jury subpoena (19 Misc. 149). The government explains the investigation timeline and contacts with victim/witness counsel, and the judge grants the government's request.

keyFacts: The document is a sealed transcript of a court conference regarding a grand jury subpoena (19 Misc. 149).
A federal investigation related to the grand jury was opened in late November or early December 2018 (Nov 30 or Dec 3).
The government contacted the law firm Boies Schiller, identified as representing victims or witnesses, early in the investigation.
Judge Colleen McMahon references wanting to avoid a 'Chemical Bank kind of situation,' indicating concern about procedural propriety.
The judge grants the government's request related to the subpoena after questioning them about pre-subpoena contacts.
